name: Dissolved Oxygen (DO)
functionStatement: Physical and chemical processes limit pollutants, retain beneficial constituents, and protect ecological and human uses.
descriptionMarkdown: DO is high enough (>5-6 mg/L) for aquatic life, unless naturally lower in warm/boggy streams.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Collect spot DO readings and compile minima from time series where available.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: >6 mg/L and no hypoxia. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 5-6 mg/L. Borderline. / 3-5 mg/L. Frequent stress. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: <3 mg/L. High risk of acute impacts. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: USGS NWIS and/or EPA Water Quality Portal (DO where available).
